title: Appalling service rude, unhelpful and condecending
body: This practise is atrocious. I have been trying to get an appointment for 2 weeks, but the phone is constantly engaged (off the hook?) Website is useless, staff are rude and unhelpful.

title: Flu clinic
body: Awesome organisation today of flu clinic.Many patients attended to in car park by friendly efficient staff. Great work üòÉüëç

title: Flu jab Clinic
body:
The practice was very well organised to handle large numbers of folks for the Flu jab, with all the necessary regulations to combat the pandemic. There were 13 teams along two corridors doing the paperwork and injecting. With a one way system, and stewarding to ensure separation between the patients.
The Flu clinic is normally well organised, but with the present difficulties, it was exceptionally well done!

title: Flu vaccination clinic - Very Safe and Efficient‚Ä¶
body:
Every aspect of our visit was extremely well staffed and organised.  Even had someone organising where to park your car.
This resulted in the whole process only taking a maximum of 10 mins from start to finish.
Well done for excellent planning, preparation and execution of the process!

title: Great Practice
body:
Attended flu clinic which was run with military precision.
Friendly staff, even sang happy birthday to a lady whilst waiting to leave.

title: Great practice
body:
We've been at Westgate for about a year and a half and they have provided great mental health care for my partner, face to face examinations for myself whilst working under huge pressure, provided efficient and caring vaccination service for my babies. We have always had prompt attention with focus on detail and utmost professionalism.
My experiences have also found them to be very supportive of breastfeeding and helping to manage the logistics of bringing baby twins to the practice with COVID rules in place. Couldn't be happier with our care.

title: Great systems in place
body: Came for flu jab - very quick, efficient and good humoured. No long queue, maximum safety measures with the minimum of fuss. The staff have gone to a lot of trouble to make patients feel welcome and safe.

title: Great telephone service
body: Rang surgery 8am on a Tuesday to request a GP phone appointment that day to facilitate a sick note. Short wait as I was no. 5 in que. Receptionist gave me an appointment for between 9am and 10:30. GP phoned me at 9:10 and dealt with my problem and provided text note plus annotation of assessment for insurance purposes. Whole process very satisfactory and easy to access. Thank you.

title: Never got past registration
body:
At 63 years of age, I've never had an NHS experience as unhelpful, difficult to communicate with and obstructive as trying to register at Westgate Practice.

I completed the lengthy online marathon of their registration form and submitted it only to be told (via a 3 stage process to access their message) that, as I'd failed to provide my NHS number, I would have to complete a new form. The box on the form requesting NHS number is NOT mandatory and, even though every page requires you to check the data submitted before you can proceed to the next page, not submitting an NHS number does not impede your progress.

When I had managed to locate my number, I messaged it to the practice, asking them to add it to my records as it is impossible to edit the form online and I am not prepared to go through the entire rigmarole again for a bureaucratic detail they never informed me was a requirement.

Unsurprisingly, I received a message (email from the usual do-not-reply address, follow a link to the website, input your date of birth and no reply function) to say they couldn't add my infomration to their records and I would have to complete a whole new application.

So I have gone elsewhere. Simple 2-page form to complete and drop in with guidance on when reception is quietest to help you, helpful website with lots of accessibility information.

Westgate appears to be set up entirely for the convenience of the staff, with absolutely zero thought to helping people or making the practice accessible. In my view, this has been a very lucky escape

title: Outstanding service
body: Just been for a flu jab and couldn't fault the impeccable logistics and overall customer service by everyone working there.  I literally was quite blown away!  Well done and thank you very much.

title: Outstanding service
body: Went up to the surgery yesterday for a minor operation (lipoma removal).  Couldn't be more impressed with the staff (Dr & 2 assistants) who conducted a smooth and very professional operation.   All done from start to finish in 40 minutes. More minor operations like this should be conducted at GP services where possible. To be fair all staff I have contact with at Westgate are brilliant.

title: Prompt treatment
body: Following a discussion with a member of reception staff who was very helpful I was able to make an appointment for a telephone consultation the next morning to discuss ongoing issues relating to my recovery from Covid.  After discussing my symptoms I was offered a face to face appointment for further physical checks and review the same day. While I recognise I was fortunate to be able to make that initial telephone appointment before they were all booked I feel that given the current difficulties with staff illness and increasing patient demand the advice and treatment I received from support and medical staff was excellent. Thank you to all concerned.

title: Terrible administration
body: It is really difficult to get through to the practice on the phone, they are very inflexible (can only see 1 issue for 1 appointment) and if you are waiting in a queue to be booked in and you go a minute over your allocated time due to their delay they won't see you).  Really poor service.

title: Worst practice
body:
At 8 am you call this surgery to book an appointment on 0121 389 2222 a person is giving a useless lecture for 5 minutes , we have to listen the lecture , there is no option to skip this , by the time you will be in queue 50 . Then you will be given an appointment saying someone will call you but there no time frame . They will call, that also one time call , if you miss the call then the next morning you need to hear the 5 mins lecture again .  sometimes no call , if you call them even in their working hours your call will be directed to badger clinic .
Heath care professional working in General hospitals are working really hard in this difficult time. 
This GP surgery people are draining money from the NHS system.

title: I feel lied to and I'm in terrible pain
body: on 04.01.2022 I talked face to face with a doctor inside the Archery medica center, who told me that he would make an appointment for me at the hospital and that he would pick up the documents virtually. Nothing and no answer. The health condition from then until today has worsened a lot. I ended up losing consciousness in the morning and much more. I sometimes vomited from my feet, etc. you play with people's lives. you send them to a & e and they send them back to gp! in one year 3 appointments canceled at other hospitals! Are you sick of hospitals or what would be the problem if I got into this situation? Am I still entitled to life ???

author: Callum8
title: Not happy about the waiting time
body: We waited more than 6 hours to been seen by a doctor because my girlfriend's water might of broke. What a joke. The service was terrible.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ckr1980
title: Care & help throughout the pandemic
body:
I called Midlock Medical Centre to have a telephone appointment with a GP. I was struggling to breathe after contracting Covid two weeks before.  
I felt I had mostly recovered from Covid & was feeling much better, then my breathing had deteriorated over the last 48hrs. I was now struggling to speak & breathe, my pulse o2 was at 90 on a home Oximeter & I was beginning to panic when coughing as I couldn't catch my breath.  
I called around 2pm & a Gp called me back within 30mins, I was told I needed to be seen & to attend the surgery that afternoon to see Dr Hay. They had Covid restrictions in place, I was to go to the back door, call reception & Dr Hay would assess me. This all worked flawlessly. I was taken into her room, she throughly listened to my chest, checked my pulse o2, did all of the relevant checks in her usual cheery thoughtful way. At no point did I feel unwelcome, that I was wasting her time or that she was putting me in any danger as she was in full ppe. She took the time to explain to my husband (socially distanced) that I was being referred to the SATA unit at QEUH.  
As a family we are in almost weekly contact with Midlock Medical Centre and have been throughout the pandemic. Myself, my children & my elderly Grandmother have ongoing health conditions. The care & help we have received from both reception & medical staff has been excellent. From emergency prescriptions, home visit to my Grandmother, advice & a genuine want to help. They really have made a massive difference in what has been a rather terrifying & uncertain time for us & an unbelievably stressful & demanding time for them.  
We are incredibly grateful for the care they have given and continue to give us. Thank you.

author: KarenO22
title: My father's cancer treatment
body:
My father has advanced prostate cancer and has been unable to walk, had severe back pain and has been sleeping and incontinent for over two months.  
My mother has reported this to the oncologist. The oncologist simply informed my mother it was the progression of the cancer and they would no longer be offering him any hospital appointments.  
This evening my father collapsed and has been seen by an NHS clinician and taken to hospital and diagnosed with hypercalcaemia. As this is relatively common when the cancer has spread to the bones (which had been previously diagnosed), why was this not checked? Why was it not considered or my parents informed it was a possibility? They have seemingly simply washed their hands of him, no advice or support or information on continued care. This shows a clear disregard for a terminally ill patient - now at risk in hospital.  
We are hoping this is treatable. However my 80 year old mother with osteoarthritis has been cleaning his urine, putting her health at risk getting my father in and out of bed and stressed as she believed his unresponsiveness was due to his approaching end of life.  
I will also be complaining about his GP who, again, has not paid attention to the symptoms, identified the problems or raised this common condition as a possibility.  
Had my mother not decided to call 999 out of fear my father was dying, we would not have discovered that this was due to a treatable condition.  
My father's lack of care, information and support has been disgraceful. None of this can be attributed to Covid pressures, an oncologist should still take cancer complications seriously.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

author: Poldy
title: Compassionate and supportive GP
body:
I am a patient of Kilwinning Medical Practice in North Ayrshire. I have been very unwell and I am slowly recovering from a debilitating depression which I had no idea was coming and I have never experienced this before. I was frightened, paranoid, anxious, ashamed and at times suicidal. I felt very vulnerable and was shocked at how physically fatigued I was. I was at my lowest ebb and in a state of decline which was very frightening. I am 43yrs old and have previously been fit and well both mentally and physically.  
I called my practice and Dr McKee contacted me quickly. He listened to me and reassured me that he could help me. I was so grateful and I was very distressed. He asked me to attend the surgery so that he could talk to me further to establish how he could help me. Even in my distress I remember feeling reassured by his manner on the telephone. I was given a same day appointment and within a couple of hours I was in his consultation room. He immediately reassured me by saying that this was my appointment and to take as much time as I needed. That it was important hear everything that I wanted to say. There was no rush. I could not believe that I had been so lucky to have this support and I knew that there would be no judgement from him. He was very respectful of me and actively listened to my emotional experiences. I remember asking him for reassurance of confidentiality. He was reassured me of this.  
Dr Mckee supported me continuously over the last six months with calls every couple of weeks at my request rather than going to the surgery which felt overwhelming to me. He always gave me the option of attending. He worked in partnership with me in relation to my treatment plan. He titrated medication, offered me CBT which has been very helpful, he listened to my experience throughout my journey through depression.  
When I reflect on where I was to where I am now I notice that there has been a significant difference. The care, compassion and support that I have received from Dr Mckee has been person-centred and of the highest quality. I will be forever grateful that I was lucky enough to have the highest standard of care during one of the most difficult periods of my life. I will never forget how he treated me and I am so glad that we have genuine, compassionate people such as Dr McKee in the profession,

title: Worst care
body: After having a biopsy I was provided with no after care. I collapsed in the hall way and  a cleaner and receptionist helped me to a chair. Prior to that I had come to the hospital for a review the consultant ignored my questions throughout and was extremely dismissive. The nurses kept interrupting when I tried to talk to the consultant which the consultant did nothing about. No after care was provided. Covid rules were not followed. (Staff room limits not followed). I sat with two other patients in the waiting room next to a so called private counselling  room. The entire conversations could be heard though paper thin doors. While waiting we heard the cleaning staff complaining how dirty the hospital is. Not a good experience at all.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I rang the surgery at 08:10 and by 10:45 I was seeing the doctor of my choice. The doctor was extremely helpful and has set up some ongoing treatment. Many thanks for  great service

title: Kendal
body:
Very good treatment on both eyes 
 It was good to get there good parking area and very helpful staff on entering the building a very busy place good job done Thankyou SpaMedica J.Barton

author: Masa
title: The doctor's caring and considerate nature
body:
After surgery at the Pilgrim Hospital in Boston, I developed a complication which took me back to A & E 5 days later. I was very fortunate that evening as Storm Arwen had just arrived, the weather was awful and as a result the attendance at Pilgrim A & E was much lower than normal. I was quickly triaged, then saw the usual practitioners and had only a short wait before being called through to see a doctor.  
The doctor concerned was Dr Seabrook, clearly a young registrar, and on my first meeting with him I was very impressed by his manner, maturity, confident (but not cocky!) demeanour and his ability to relate to me, convey information and, equally importantly, to listen!  
After receiving a tentative diagnosis I was admitted to the relevant ward but saw him again several times over the next few days. He continued to impress me with his professionalism and also demonstrated his caring and considerate nature.  
His personality and behaviour as a professional inspired total confidence in me with respect to his knowledge and abilities; I had absolutely no doubt that in the event he was uncertain about something or required input from consultant(s) he would not hesitate to ask.  
When Dr Seabrook said he would do something (like coming back to see me later to update me on something or to check how I was doing) he followed through, this despite, I am certain, a very hectic schedule!  
I cannot speak too highly of this young doctor who has, I am absolutely certain, a very bright and personally rewarding future ahead of him in the medical world. Well done NHS and Pilgrim Hospital on finding (and hopefully keeping!) this brilliant young man.

title: Visit Gastro Unit
body: I visited Gastro unit for a procedure on the 14th of Dec 2021. From the moment I arrived I was really well looked after. I was put at ease and had the procedure explained to me. The staff in theatre were all brilliant and really reassured me. I cannot thank the staff enough. Very professional service.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: worst experience ever with a surgery
body: My first 23 attempts to ring this surgery were met with the engaged tone and then on a call queue for 1 hour. I had to end the call due to a meeting. After a further 12 attempts, I have been waiting for 2 hours. If you are thinking of registering at this practice, I suggest you go elsewhere. Suffering in pain would be a better alternative to this place.

title: Quick appoinment
body: I did an online consultation in the morning and i was expecting gp will call me to discuss the treatment but instead i got the appoinment on the same day which is really good, usually is hard to get one.

author: Ozzy95
title: The care provided by the district nurse team
body:
A couple of weeks ago my mother, her husband and carers tested positive for covid.  
This meant they had no care coming in apart from me.  
Mum has Parkinson's and cannot do anything for herself and having no carers meant she was bed bound .  
Her husband a blind double amputee with diabetes luckily had visits from the District Nurse team twice a day to administer his insulin.  
Seeing the situation they were in the District Nurse team stepped up and helped me provide essential care to mum when they came to see her husband. With out this help mum would have been admitted into hospital as despite many pleas for help no one at Nottinghshire social services was able to provide any help .  
I would like to pass on my thanks to the team, they have gone over and above to help in this very difficult situation. They have been absolutely brilliant.  
I believe this shines a light onto the poor state of social care and without the kindness of others the lack of care will lead to more people to be admitted into hospital, taking up beds that they medically don't need.

author: BadAssWolfShirt1985
title: Had my implant replaced
body:
Dr Bretland and assisting nurse (I couldn't remember his name really sorry) were excellent I'm glad they are both in the NHS as we need more people like them both.I was reassured through the whole process. I have anxiety, they were chatty and friendly I felt really welcoming we even had a giggle  
Dr Bretland was gentle while fitting the implant and removing the old one and was gentle administrating the anaesthetic, I didn't feel the implant being removed and the new one added.  
Both were professional helpful and friendly this is why it's so important we protect our NHS and staff. As it's been so difficult for staff during the pandemic.

title: Excellent experience
body: I phoned the Buxted Medical Centre in the afternoon and although the answerphone was telling me there were no appointments available, after I had discussed my symptoms with the receptionist, I was offered one the following day.  My appt at the surgery was on time and I had an extremely pleasant and empathetic and thorough consultation.  I was referred for further tests which I booked face to face with a very helpful receptionist before leaving, without any problem. Overall my experience of Buxted medical centre was excellent especially as they have been confronted with a difficult period over the past couple of years. Because of the difficulty of accessing any communication and/or appointments I had given up trying to be a patient with the surgery so I was absolutely delighted that improvements are being put into train. Well done to everyone who is making this happen. Thank you.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Long waits for assistance for the bathroom
body: My care so far has been 90 percent good, there‚Äôs just a few minor issues that make the care slightly less than perfect for example there are times when nurses well walk past me when I have rang the bell and just little things like that. The food is also not at a good level with it often being badly cooked and there being no real variety when u have been in a few weeks. The food is also often bland and at times can be very cold. The rooms are very clean with the cleaners in a couple of times a day. I am always kept up to date with my treatment plan. My last comment is that the nurses are brilliant however there is sometimes a long wait for assistance using the bathroom which I feel at times is very embarrassing

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptional care
body: My care has been fantastic with the whole experience being great. The food has been excellent and I can have no complaints about the quality of it. The nurses do their best or you and are so easy to understand and take such good care of us. The place has been spotless since I arrived and has stayed that way thanks to the amazing cleaners. I will hopefully be discharged tonight and want to thank everybody for the exceptional care I have received.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Monpg66
title: Great care at Minor Injuries
body:
I would like to thank Gaynor and the team at the Minor Injuries Department at University Hospital Monklands.  
She was so kind and caring with my 2 year old son who had broken his collar bone. She went out her way to make him feel comfortable, calm and distracted. She was so professional and caring.  
We were attended to quickly and given discharge advice and written information to take home.  
I can‚Äôt thank her enough! An asset to the hospital.

author: aprilyn65
title: Video call with my father
body: Setting up the call was very easy and VVS staff were efficient, empathetic and helpful.  The call to my father in one of the wards at RVH connected at the appointed time and the video and sound quality were good.  I live overseas and the opportunity to see and talk to my father was very much appreciated - there was some background noise from the ongoings in the ward, but only to be expected and a small price to pay for the opportunity.  End-to-end the VVS service was pretty seamless and a great help at a difficult time for our family.  Thank you sincerely to the team.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Endoscopy Unit
body: Attended the department for a colonoscopy procedure and was looked after and put at ease by all the staff. A positive experience.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful care
body: Phoned up in the afternoon concerned about my son, and was squeezed in for a face to face appointment within 20 minutes. The Dr was very thorough, very good with my 10 year old and sent helpful additional information via text message after the appointment. Despite a global pandemic, we received exceptional care I would have been grateful to have received in much more normal times. This isn't my first positive experience of this surgery but it's a single experience within a trend of good experiences. Though they seem very busy, their competence and  care shines through.

author: Lorxw68
title: Should have been seen by now
body: In year 2020 I had pain in my left arm for a few months I phoned my gp for a appointment but didn't get to see anyone because of covid, so I explained what was going on and they thought it was cellulite but I told them it wasn't. I was given antibiotics so I took them, didn't help me so I phoned back then they told me to go to A&E which I did. A&E referred me for a MRI that showed up that I have a bulging disc in my spinal cord so doctor at A&E referred me to neurosurgery which ave been waiting for appointment from September 2020. I have been phoning them to see where I was on the list its a 2 year waiting time told them a couldn't wait that long because am suffering from neuropathic pain which is getting worse now am suffering from drop foot I did have physio they put me on hold because it was making the pain worse my doctor prescribed me pregablin but they don't help the pain in my both arms and my lower back. It's affecting my work am struggling now am tripping all over the place with the drop foot. I phone neurosurgery in January 2022 to see where a was on the list, told me again its a long waiting time so a told them Ave been waiting from September 2020 the person a spoke to was in shock, said a should have seen by now then told me to phone my GP again to get a urgent referral again saying my symptoms are worse. I feel am just getting fobbed off. Just can't handle this pain anymore, had enough.

author: sambajy65
title: Visit to A&E
body: My visit was smooth and reassuring . The waiting time was shorter than expected and was treated with the upmost respect . Dr Dan was amazing. Well done Basildon A&E

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Trikg86
title: My husband's stay at the hospital
body: The staff were brilliant, only met one consultant, and he was great.Had an appointment with someone in charge, never turned up, my son, myself and daughter in law, who took 4 hours unpaid leave to be there, and husband's social worker, were left sitting there for hour and a half, no show.Got husband moved to nursing home, staff there fantastic. Was brought there with only 7 items of clothing which were his, another bag of rags I would have thrown in a bin. Has lost several hundred pounds worth of clothes over the time of his stay at the hospital, spectacles I paid for gone, laundry unit at the hospital to blame.But nursing staff in Larkfield unit weren't at fault, they were so caring, should be paid more than they earn.

author: Lbrown22
title: Unacceptable waiting time with a child
body: Was left 4 hours + in a waiting room with a 2 year old child struggling to breath! A&E department filled up and emptied 3 times whilst we waited, not only that he slipped in the child waiting room and bumped his head on the floor resulting in a massive egg on his head and red mark. When I went to the reception to ask for an ice pack or something and the reply was, we don‚Äôt do that here. I'm sorry it‚Äôs a hospital! Was not offered any painkillers for him or nothing! He had had no dinner or nothing, not any information when we'd be seen! I feel absolutely done in and so does my child! It is not acceptable to leave a 2 year old breathless for such a length of time.

title: Warm and friendly care
body: I got an appointment on the same day I called and had a kind, warm, friendly, and thorough consultation. I felt heard and well looked after and am really satisfied with all the follow up tests provided.

author: jockmcglinchey
title: Cancer care in Lanarkshire
body:
I contacted my GP early September 2021 as I had suffered abdominal pain which was getting progressively worse.  
I had an initial telephone consultation and was advised to get bloods done before he would see me. Two weeks later I had a phone call from the receptionist to come in and pick up a Qfit test as I had an iron deficiency. I collected it and returned it next day. Although I had another telephone appointment booked, I received a call 2 days beforehand, whilst at work, from the doctor advising that he suspected I had Bowel Cancer and was making an urgent referral for double scope. He told me this could take up to 5 weeks.  
After recovering from the initial shock I discussed this with my family and we scraped the money together to have the endoscope procedures carried out at Ross Hall Hospital in the belief that this would expedite the process. I had a colonoscopy carried out which identified a moderately differentiated caecal adenocarcinoma. My GP was provided with the full details of the procedure including images and a copy of the biopsy report. I was referred to the Colorectal Cancer Pathway at NHS Lanarkshire.  
Two weeks later, feeling quite anxious at the lack of information, I dropped into the Maggie‚Äôs Centre at Monklands Hospital. The Cancer Support Worker was very helpful and arranged for a nurse from the Colorectal Team to call me the following day. As a result of this I had a CT Scan arranged. I received a call from the Colorectal nurse on Christmas Eve advising that I had been discussed at the MDT meeting that morning and the scan had shown a node on my adrenal gland. I was being referred urgently for a scan of the adrenal gland prior to confirmation of surgery. She said this would take around 2 weeks. After waiting 3 weeks I contacted the Colorectal Team again and was advised they would make another urgent referral. To date I have still not received an appointment for the scan.  
I am now 14 weeks from the urgent referral by my GP and 12 weeks from diagnosis and still have no idea when I can expect any form of treatment plan. During this entire period the only doctor I have seen is the Consultant I paid to carry out the colonoscopy who expressed strongly the urgency that was required.  
I believe that one of the worst things a person can hear is that they have cancer. I expected that on hearing such news there would be a system in place to offer support, keep me informed and an urgency to prevent the cancer from growing and spreading. I feel I have been abandoned and worry that by the time someone actually sees me it will be too late.

author: NatH22
title: Wrist fracture
body: I respect all the staff in the job they do, but I wasn't given any information about aftercare and exercises I need to do regarding improving my recovery. I'm 6 weeks after breaking my wrist, I've just had my cast taken off and only now have I been told about hand and wrist exercises on the website. Looking at the website I should have been stretching fingers and thumb while in cast which I was never told. I see now a web address has been added at the end of your letters, which is really a tag on, an after thought, also it does not tell me to go on the website to do important exercises to improve recovery. The consultant when they saw me the other day was shocked at how stiff my hand and fingers were. Had I been doing the exercises for the last 6 weeks with my fingers maybe I would be further along with finger movements. I am so dissappointed. At this 6wk appointment I was shown exercises to do, but I had to ask for a handout on this, and this was the 1st time the website was mentioned and written down. Surely all this information should have be given at each appointment to ensure I am doing the right exercises to ensure a speedier recovery for me. Whilst in cast I had a few concerns with swelling and went on the internet to find out about elevating hand above the heart or icing cast. Again I feel this is information patients should be informed of. Our telephone numbers when we arrive, if a patient has a mobile number they could send a text with a link to the website explaining exercises to do to improve recovery and for any details regarding your fracture. Just a thought.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My time in hospital
body: I am hoping to get out of hospital today, if not, I will be going into my third week on orthopaedics. I can't complain about anything. The staff are great, the hygiene is impeccable and the ward is so open and spacious. I am certainly ready to get home to my own bed but I have always felt content in the orthopaedics ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: High praise for the staff
body: I have been in hospital as I had pneumonia and a blot clot in my lungs. Despite being so unwell only a few days ago, I am going home today which is testimony to how efficiently and effectively the staff work. Everything is absolutely brilliant. My care plan is always explained to me, I know I am waiting on the pharmacist to come meet me before I leave, regarding my medications.  The staff are approachable and I can't thank them enough. Everyone on orthopaedics... you are superb!!!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Super care
body:
I have been in and out of hospital from the end of December. Initially, I had fallen and broken my hip. The Doctors didn't carry out a procedure due to my history of heart and kidney problems. I got home but came back in a few days ago with further problems. The hospital is a place I certainly don't want to be in right now, but the staff are making it ''100 times easier''. The communication the entire time has been excellent and my care plan has always been made clear to me. I am awaiting tests which hopefully will be carried out tomorrow, one step closer to getting home.  
The ward is spotless and I love the food, I couldn't say a bad word about ward 4 South!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wait forever!
body: Was a great practice, but deteriorated massively since. Normal for appointments to be delayed for up to an hour each visit. Similarly for telephone to be answered e.g. today 61 mins and then cut off. No response to complaints other than a holding letter. Hard pressed to get anything done particularly with chronic comorbidities.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The lovely nurses and doctors
body:
I feel so content in Ward 3 South. The nurses and doctors are marvellous... so approachable and patient. I can be quite confused at times, but they are always willing to wait and listen. The food is just beautiful; a slice of toast always cheers me up!  
I have no idea when I am going to get home, but I know I am safe and cared for here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Asthma review text link- dob query
body: The dob option is hopeless. I was born in 1955 the calendar to click on starts in Jan 2022 and only option is to click back monthly..I gave up and left my dob as 29.11.2021 as, frankly, I'm not clicking back nearly 800 months!

title: Phones and reception staff
body:
Your telephone system is absolutely awful. I have been advised you upgraded and it has not gone well, this isn‚Äôt good a enough response and I can see a response to another patient comment here back from August so it has been nearly 5 months or more. Whilst I can empathise to an extent that your phone provider is the problem you must take more responsibility and put pressure on to fix it, the way it is now cannot carry on. I have been on hold for hours at a time last week and again today, as soon as you get past position 3 in the queue it stops telling you where you are. I went from 7 to 3 and then was on hold for a further 40 minutes before the line went silent, called back and was back to number 8, again when I got ‚Äúyou are caller number 3‚Äù there were no updates as to my position again. 
When I came in for an evening appointment last week your receptionist at the time was just plain rude, no eye contact, blank expressionless, very quiet when asking questions then seems irritated when you can‚Äôt hear her properly yet didn‚Äôt answer when I asked something politely of her - GP asked me to have reception print something as his machine wasn‚Äôt working, she just turned away‚Ä¶someone with zero people skills should not be in that role, even if you are not up to forming a full sentence you could you say ‚Äúyes‚Äù so I know you‚Äôve heard me. I tried to ask about the phone system and she just ignored that part, may be sick of hearing it from other patients and now chooses to not speak? GP receptionists tend to get a bad rep but I prefer the ones that are running around in chaos, you can excuse them for coming across rude when so busy, this lady was just blatantly rude.
I will be leaving this anonymous as I am not requiring you to contact me off the back of this, just please take it on board and fix your core problems, the GP‚Äôs I have spoken to and seen recently have been very good, it‚Äôs a shame about the battle when you are already sick and weak to get to them past that phone and the front desk!

author: learningzs83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Boring stay but excellent staff
body:
I have been on the Male Medical Ward a while now. As with every hospital stay it has been very monotonous, long and boring. However, the staff have all been excellent - there hasn't been one who I couldn't say was not good - so far!  
The ward itself has been clean and comfortable.  
The only thing I think needs improving is that there needs to be somewhere to exercise. I just feel that there needs to be somewhere to go to allow you to stretch your legs other than just to the toilet and back again.  
Another area for improvement would be the food. Some of the food has been quite bad. Today's (Sunday) has been good. However, Saturday's chicken in breadcrumbs was like eating rubber. There is also no variety, no salads and not much choice for those on a fluid balanced diet. There is also no variety in fruit - melon, strawberries etc.  
I also feel that there has been a lack of fresh air - open windows would be nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: gifttm97
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything great on Maternity
body:
My time in Daisy Hill Hospital's Maternity Ward has been great so far.  
The staff have all been absolutely lovely - really approachable and friendly. I would particularly like to mention Adele who delivered my little boy - she was absolutely fabulous.  
The ward itself has had everything I have needed. There is nothing I can think of which needs improving - everything has been great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lisglas1034
title: Altnagelvin hospital.
body: Food was very poor. Not really the staffs fault as they were dreadfully short of staff. The staff themselves from top to bottom were excellent. Always willing to help, knew what they were doing and willing to explain and answer questions. I couldn‚Äôt praise them enough.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Cruel handling of people's health and a waste of‚Ä¶
body:
I received a message on Thursday asking me to call a health advisor from Dean street. Nobody has taken my calls until I called another number and asked to be redirected on Friday.

The nurse called me on Friday saying I could only get the medication in the person and there‚Äôs only availability for Monday. I‚Äôve tried to contact my GP but they couldn‚Äôt prescribe the medication, since they didn‚Äôt have the laboratory results. 

On Monday I arrived at 56 dean street and they made me wait more than one hour, in addition, since the system was slow, they even tried to make me wait again, but luckily the system worked until they could check my details. The doctor had to check drug interactions but there was no pharmacist taking his calls, leading to more delays.

So I‚Äôve lost half of my working day and had to travel to the city center for something that could certainly be done over the phone since they were only antibiotics tablets, which is not even a controlled drug.

Leaving someone with STI symptoms for 4 days only because you need them to get the medication in person for no obvious reason is cruel and I would definitely expect more from the NHS. It was also the date I would get the vaccine for hepatitis, which I couldn't get because they couldn't save in the system.

If you can‚Äôt handle the process properly and facilitate people‚Äôs life you should make their records available to them so they can use private healthcare.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sugna20
title: Day surgery procedure
body:
My son had day surgery for a lateral miniscus tear and was admitted to ward 1a. The care and treatment was first class through out: the nursing assistant, nurses, anaesthetist, physio, junior doctor and surgeon. They anticipated my son and my needs and looked after us both with care, compassion, kindness. They explained each step of care as it progressed. It is care and treatment like this that makes the NHS the most amazing and valuable organisation. Thank you so much for looking after our son so well, we are very grateful.  
The only thing I thought was strange was that my son was covid screened the day before surgery. The strange thing about it was that he was told he could then go to school rather than isolate in preparation for admission. Also, I was attending the hospital admission with him yet there was no requirement for me to be covid screened.

title: It‚Äôs been so disappointing in recent times.
body:
We had thought that Cromwell Place Medical Practice was, probably, the best in St Ives.  Now that it is The Grove, we and many of our friends, think it‚Äôs, probably, the worst.
Despite a huge increase in admin staff, the service to patients has really deteriorated.
It‚Äôs not possible to book a F2F appointment under any circumstances, even though, when the condition is described, it‚Äôs blindingly obvious that a doctor would not be able diagnose over the phone.
The new reception area is such that all those in the waiting room can hear all the details of each person‚Äôs problems - personal confidentiality??
The online booking is a joke.  Recently, I tried to book an appointment, telephone of course.  After several early mornings seeing ‚Äúno sessions available‚Äù, I was eventually able to book for 4 weeks time.
It‚Äôs hard to understand what all the doctors are doing.  I was in the waiting room today from 10am - 11am, in that time, one patient entered for a doctor‚Äôs appointment (remember, I could hear all that was said at Reception).
However, I don‚Äôt blame the doctors for this very poor service.  They‚Äôve all been great for all the 13 years that we‚Äôve been patients at the practice.  I guess the the blame must lie with the relatively new management.  They need to think that their ‚Äúcustomers‚Äù are the priority.

author: Emmgh49
title: Care and communication from staff is great
body: On Tuesday I was admitted via ambulance to Craigavon hospital the wait for the ambulance to come was around one hour, which isn‚Äôt too bad as I understand how busy they are at the moment. The overall care and communication from the staff has been very good and clear. The other support staff have also been amazing, the cleaners never stop and the ward is kept clean and tidy throughout the whole day. The food I have been receiving has been lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing food
body: I was admitted through ED two weeks ago because of my heart problems; the staff on this ward have been fantastic they have all been very friendly and caring. This ward is always kept very clean and the support staff do a very good job. The food has been amazing and the selection is great, I like the way I have been able to choose different meals every day.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastc Surgery
body:
I cannot praise Gill Medical Practice highly enough. The admin staff and doctors provide a fantastic service. Whenever I have phoned the practice the call is always answered promptly and the staff are very efficient and friendly. Appointments are made quickly and text messages sent to my phone. The doctors i see also are very caring and attentively listen to any problems that I may have and always put me at ease.
Results of blood tests have always been  conveyed within a week and any follow up appointments made within a short timescale.  
My Covid and booster vaccinations were arranged promptly and the whole process very effectively managed.
I would thorougly recommend Gill Medical Practice for anybody looking for a surgery with great staff, doctors and nurses.

title: Not fit for purpose
body: When you make an appointment for a 89 year old man to have something as simple as a dressing changed. Appointment impossible at local surgery so sent to Aldeburgh. Nurse and GP were 'unable'  to cope with something this simple. Said patient was sent to A&E. The hospital staff were actually disgusted the patient was sent and even said there was no need to have gone and the GP surgery should have dealt with the appointment. Seems to me they need a practice nurse who is actually trained and capable.

title: Thank you
body: I just want to say thank you for the courteous , efficient and pleasant way I have been dealt with today from booking my appointment, to being received and booked in with a smile, to the caring doctor who saw me and the receptionists and secretary who did the follow up work immediately. Routine for all of them I am sure but I truly appreciated it. Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body:
I‚Äôve been with this practice for almost 3 years now, so a majority of my experience has been through the pandemic. As the practice is shared between Martock and South Petherton I have found there is always help at either. I think all the doctors, nurses and admin do a wonderful job considering how many people they look after during such a difficult time for the NHS. 
THANK YOU to all who have called me back within hours to help, to the girls on reception for being so reassuring and helpful, and the doctor who has seen me and helped me so much in such little time. This is a lovely practice filled with kind and helpful people throughout.

title: Excellent service
body: I had suffered a fall, which resulted in a bad blow to my head. The Doctor and Nurse who looked after me were excellent. They both were friendly, kept me informed and kept me calm. The paramedics at the scene were also excellent and I feel very grateful to everyone who looked aftered me.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing experience
body: I received the absolute best care, I arrived at A&E at 9am on a Monday morning and within minutes had seen the on duty doctor who referred me straight away to the DVT Dept. I was again seen straight away, had bloods taken and an ultrasound. I honestly couldn't have had any better or quicker care.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing staff
body: I‚Äôm currently awaiting to get an operation, and have been on this ward since Wednesday. The staff have all made me feel so welcome and comfortable here. They are really amazing, I‚Äôve been informed about every part of my care that I have received, which is very helpful. The ward is always very clean, which makes me feel so much more comfortable. The food has been alright, the selection is quite poor.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: intensitynh78
title: A comfortable stay
body:
My experience in Daisy Hill has been an overall good one. I have been made very comfortable by the kind and helpful staff members who I am incredibly grateful for.  
The staff have all been absolutely wonderful. I couldn't pick anybody out in particular as they are all so good and really kind.  
The only issue I would have would be staff members answering the buzzer. I appreciate they are very busy, but sometimes you really need a staff member and can be waiting quite a while.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing care
body:
After a few hours wait at A&E in Stoke, we were told there is a bed for my son at Alder Hey as he would need a scope procedure the next morning. We experienced kind assistance, professional behaviour. Several times was I explained what would be done to my son before signing consent. I was allowed to be with him until the anesthetic kicked in and they walked me back to him as he started to stir after the procedure. I saw they were explaining things to him too and made sure he was comfortable. I appreciate everyone who works so hard, even over Christmas, so that we could be helped.
I did not understand why I did not have to undergo a covid test since I was allowed to be with my son and around the staff. For the safety of hospital employees and patients, I think child‚Äôs company should also be tested. 
Thank you, everyone.

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Doctor is very polite and extremely helpful
body:
Your Review:  Highly recommended surgery  Doctor is very polite and extremely helpful person.
I believe she is very good human and
very professional and intelligent
Doctor.I am lucky to have this surgery.

author: Perseus
title: An excellent service
body:
I visited the Urology Department at Barnstable hospital with prostate concerns. Seen by Dr Enamine. Very personable doctor, a short rectal examination and a result in terms of 'what to do next'.  
Very grateful for his time and expertise. An excellent service overall.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Hap92
title: Excellent care
body: I recently gave birth at the Midwives unit in 2021, i felt at ease from the moment i walked through the door, initially being looked after by Midwives Lauren and then onto midwife Katy who supported me with an amazing water birth experience. I initially had to wait for the pool to be available but the midwives made this possible which will always be appreciated. I couldn't remember the midwife assistants names but they made sure my husband was topped up with coffee and supported me with breast feeding after wards. Thank you all so very much for our positive experience and we will be eternally grateful for all you did.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Wetfire
title: Condition Management Programme
body:
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
[Very happy with 'Keeping in touch']  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
[Very happy with 'Transport']  
[Very happy with 'Involved in decisions']  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Very happy with 'Future plans']

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Above and Beyond Every time
body: I joined the practice last year after moving to Medway, I have received nothing bu amazing service, this could possibly be the best GP surgery in the country.  The reception and admin team, are super friendly and do everything they can to help.  I have been very ill recently and been in communication frequently and they have made every step easy and stress free, the GP's are knowledgable, caring and very quick with responses.  Thank you so much for all you do.

author: Sin√©adyB
title: Speech and language help for my child
body: I attended a zoom meeting in regards to my son who's speech at the minute is slightly behind. During the meeting I recieved information about strategies to use in helping my sons understanding and development of his language skills.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: Really wonderful nurses who take care and time to make sure you feel safe and comfortable. They also take the time to answer any questions and make sure you are ok with everything and understand everything couldn't ask for better treatment

title: Great Care
body: I was so impressed with my appointment today. The GP was brilliant and the appointment was thorough, thoughtful and reassuring, I felt very well looked after. The appointment was simple to make and I was seen immediately. Thank you West Hampstead Medical Centre!

title: Very Efficient
body: The bookings team are very good and very efficient.  The clinic I attend is very good the staff that do the appointments are very pleasant, with no problems.  The whole service is very good.

title: Terrific  Team at Spa Medica
body: My visit to spa medica was a lovely experience  with kind caring and very friendly  staff. Very professional  from entering to leaving the building e.g reception, nursing staff and eye surgeon made me feel very calm and relaxed .My eye seems to be healing well and it's amazing that I can see so clear,cannot  wait for my other eye to be done .A big thank you to all at Spa Medica ,see you all very  soon for my next surgery.

title: Outstanding GP practice
body: I have been a patient with the surgery for the past 6 years. The service and the care I have received has always been outstanding. Urgent appointments are always accommodated, GPs never delay referrals if they think they are needed, never feel like I have not been listened to or that my concerns have been ignored. The nurses are also fab - I have a bit of a fear of blood tests but they are always so quick that I barely get the time to get nervous. Hats off to everyone working here - thank you.

author: songthrushzk57
title: Virtual visit in ICU
body:
I booked a visit with my father in law in ICU, so he could see and talk to his wife and sons. A few days ago we didn't know if he would make it or not, he was so ill, on a ventilator and fighting septic shock. His wife and daughter were allowed in one afternoon, as he was being taken off the ventilator.  
The Dr's didn't know if he would be able to breath on his own. He looked so terribly ill that day.Thankfully he did and is continuing to make progress. We will continue to pray for his recovery üôè  
No one had been able to see him, because of covid restrictions and he was getting very low. It was also very distressing for his family, not being able to be there with him. We had a virtual visit with him yesterday. It was so lovely for him to be able to see his wife and some of the family. It really lifted his spirits and gave us all a lift, to see him doing better and able to talk with us a little.  
It's a very difficult time for the family. We know the staff in ICU have been amazing and we are so thankful and although, nothing, beats a visit in person, these virtual visits are priceless!!  
We are due to have another one today. We are looking forward to it.  
Thank you and God bless the work you are doing üíñüíñüíñ

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent GP Practice
body: Very caring, considerate and professional. Nothing to much trouble. Very helpful Doctors and reception staff.

author: airgw74
title: I felt very supported
body: I felt very supported by the unit, nurse explained everything to me and arranged follow up for results. The nurse couldn't have been any nicer to be honest. The whole experience was made so much better by the professionalism shown. Thank you very much

title: Excellent experience
body:
Very professional service throughout. Staff very friendly
and helpful. Would certainly recommend if asked.
Happy to return for other eye when needed.

author: Marylin Munrow
title: Good service
body:
I have had occasion to experience the service given by your staff after an arrangement made by my GP.  
Your staff are very professional , caring and for me the treatment administered has been beneficial. A service for which I am grateful.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

title: Excellent Practice
body:
Having only very recently registered with this practice, I was able to access care surprisingly quickly for ongoing back problems. The reception team were very helpful and I was able to get a telephone consultation from a doctor the same day and a digital prescription sent straight to my nominated pharmacy. I was also given a face to face appointment the next morning. The doctor I  saw was very attentive and I was able to give a detailed history and discuss several issues over the course of a long appointment.
I was then given a referral for further care.
I was left with the overall impression of being listened to and having my concerns taken seriously.
I left very satisfied with the standard of care .

title: Great course.
body:
I have just recently completed my final session with Talking Therapies 
and I would like to take this opportunity to say thank you for all the help and assistance during this difficult time. 
The course and techniques have been very helpful.
I was treated with dignity and kindness during the entire process. At all times The degree of respect and professionalism was exemplary. It was also the level of compassion and care that I appreciated above all. 
I would have no hesitation in recommending this therapy. 
Kind regards,
Stephen.

title: First Class Treatment
body: I attended FGH for a very fast heart rate, sent by GP. The care I received was first class. It was quick and professional. I felt at all times that my problem was important and I saw three doctors from different sections of the hospital. A junior doctor, a medical doctor and a registrar from cardiology. In each case the doctor listened arranged for appropriate tests and always left me knowing what was going to happen next. I was sent home with medication and a plan in place for future review and tests. All the staff I met from reception through to the doctors including x-ray, support staff and nurses were all pleasant and gave me confidence in what they were doing.

author: mercurybx65
title: Staff going beyond the call of duty
body:
Following chest pain, I came to A&E. The staff were all great. There was nothing bad about the staff - they really go beyond the call of duty in current conditions.  
I had to wait a couple of days before getting a bed. However, once I got a bed I couldn't have been treated better on the Male Medical Ward. The nurses and doctors have been great and got me sorted.  
Nurse Bernice has been excellent and all the doctors who saw me yesterday have been ever so helpful. All the nurses have been amazing and anything I needed they sorted for me. Anna who was on at night was also brilliant.  
I have no improvements to suggest regarding my care. However, Essentially more beds are needed as well as a new hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Endoscopy Department - Excellent Service
body: I just wanted to say 'thank you' for looking after my partner this morning. The lady on reception was very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.  My partner has anxiety and the doctors and nurses he came into contact with were all very understanding and helped him through his procedure. Thank you again, your work is much appreciated.

title: Vaccine Clinic Great!
body: The vaccine clinic is great, especially for people with needle phobia and anxiety. They were so kind and supportive towards me, and I was able to have a nurse I am familiar with inject me-this helped my anxiety a lot. I was a little dizzy afterwards, and a nurse stayed beside me whilst I lay down. As I had reached out to the clinic beforehand, they were aware I was coming and expecting me. They let everybody know I was here which helped so much. The clinic was busy, which was a little overwhelming for somebody with anxiety, but I got through it with their support. I did almost leave a few times as I was so overwhelmed. It might be worth doing a set hour here and there, where there are less people around. This might support those with disabilities and anxiety. It might make it more accessible and less daunting for some people like myself, who struggle with busy places and anxiety. Otherwise fab job quys- I wouldn‚Äôt have had it without you.

title: Thank you.
body:
Fantastic service. Emailed and was seen same day and referred straight away. 
Could not fault the service at all.

author: inspirers79
title: Staff all great team players
body:
Following several fainting episodes I came to Daisy Hill's Emergency Department. I had an excellent experience here. To me it seemed obvious that the staff have to put up with a lot. However, from my experience the staff have been lovely from the front door right up to the ward - absolutely excellent.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has been absolutely brilliant. I don't think that people really appreciate the health service enough. The staff have all been excellent from the cleaners to the doctors - they are all doing a great job. I cannot single out anybody in particular - they are all great team players.  
I have nothing I can think of which needs improved - the whole system is very good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Reception
body: Well impressed with reception staff. No waiting for hours on the phone line, very professional and friendly approach of the staff with ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude. Great service.

title: Wonderful as ever
body: Went to the practice today saw a gp trainee   who was lovely  very knowledgeable and thorough.also whilst in waiting room overheard the receptionist dealing with somone who really wasn't being very reasonable. The receptionist was so patient and helpful.this practice has really maintained their standards in what has been an incredibly difficult time for gp practices.

title: Pleasant & efficient staff
body: Made an appointment online as requested, attended surgery where there were good procedures in place regarding safety & Covid/Omicron. Health monitoring process carried out as arranged. Good to know practice is keeping an eye on my health. Staff were great.

title: Outstanding Care
body:
Having been a patient of many surgeries over the years in various parts of the country,  I have a lot of experiences of different practices. 
Parbold surgery is an outstanding surgery, they listen and take immediate action when needed.
All the staff from reception, nurses and doctors are brilliant.

author: JUST22
title: Excellent care
body: I was a planned day surgery patient, staff were welcoming, the anaesthetist (Dr Stevenson) and anaesthetist nurse were so kind and reassuring when I was feeling anxious.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

title: Extremely helpful
body:
Brilliant GP that spent time to explain things , listen & discuss. Admin are always so helpful and sorted out an issue I had very efficiently.
As a nurse I am very happy with this practice and would recommend it.

title: Eye Unit
body: Had appointment today at the Eye Unit. From reception through to the various departments I was treated in just the most lovely and caring manner. Thank you to everyone within the Unit. Much appreciated. Constance Smethurst

author: Rfchottie87
title: The staff went above and beyond
body: My daughter caught her finger in a wooden fire door hinge at school, we attended Stobhill minor injuries and were told that she would have to attend the ward 1A at the RHC. We attended at 7am the following day. We were checked into a small room within the ward as my daughter covid results weren't back yet. The nurse we met was absolutely amazing and she kept my daughter very calm. I met with the surgeon who told me that they would be removing her nail and cleaning it out and if she needed any stitches then this would be done while she was under general anesthetic. We were moved into a ward after her results came back. All staff were very kind to both me and my daughter. The anesthetist came round and recommended that my daughter has a pre med as she has adhd this worked very well and when we went down to the theatre she was very relaxed which helped me to be okay with her going under. After the surgery she was brought back and was in great spirits. All the staff went above and beyond and I am very grateful to each and every 1 of them who helped my daughter when she was in the ward.

author: Irepy99
title: My husbands cancer
body: My husband had lung cancer 17 yrs ago which was successfully treated. He has COPD and recently taken pneumonia. After the pneumonia, an xray was taken of his lungs and they found a shadow on one of the lungs. He hadn't been feeling well at all and things were investigated further. His mobility started to suffer and it was found that his lung cancer had returned and a tumour was found in his spine. Myself and my family just felt deflated he has suffered with his breathing since his first time with cancer and I just don't think we were thinking that it could possibly have returned. Treatment was given very quickly to his spine, to save his mobility, but as an operation was not an option on his lung, nothing could be done after tests. We are now just living day to day trying to make him as comfortable and pain free as we can. The service we received at the Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy has been excellent - they acted very quickly. Ed, my husbands nurse, has always been there to answer any questions and for reassurance.

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife

title: Glimmer of hope
body: This surgery has been declining for several years but I am not sure what has happened recently but there is a glimmer of hope that is is on the road to recovery.  Not sure what has changed but my last two experiences in December and January have been much more positive with staff actually listening and trying to help instead of just fobbing you off, there seems a totally different atmosphere about the place so please Springhill, whatever it is you have changed, keep doing it.
